channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cracked, uneven, sunken and damaged pavement by busy stop and post box on Nine Elms Road near the Greyhound junction., 21st December
item.description:
Hello In the past few (since 16th) days there has been damage and degrading conditions to the pavement, by the post box and bus stop at Nine Elms Road (by the Greyhound pub junction) . I'm concerned with the postbox, bus stop and the kids bikes that further damage to the current state of the pavement could result in injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Commercial multi pack rappers, fly tipped outside number 63 Pitman Road, 21st December
item.description:
There is a regular offender inside this block of flats who seems to think it’s OK to put that rubbish bye. Can somebody come and pick it up please and also take away the barriers

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Pitman Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncompleted works, 21st December
item.description:
Following a previous enquiry I received this message this afternoon Enquiry Update - Completion of Works - Enquiry 22035144 The repair team have been here for 3 days but haven’t repaired deep pot holes along a 15 metre stretch of road… plus may be others further along Old Brockhampton Road I spoke to them yesterday and they said they were aware of these potholes but now have not repaired them. They also commented that they where using 6mm tarmac which for the farm traffic that constantly uses the road probably wasn’t sufficient and should be 10mm… every other repair done on our road has failed within 2 years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Brockhampton Road, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 21st December
item.description:
Tall thin tree that is leaning over into the road. This has moved quite a lot since this morning, tree is propably dead and caller is concerned that this will fall onta a car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic lights are extremely slow to respond to traffic causing large queues when busy, 21st December
item.description:
I am a local resident. I see pupils from the local school taking chances crossing the road as they get impatient waiting for the lights to change and the green man appear. This has been an issue for at least 2 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 21st December
item.description:
email rcvd 20.12.23 - 19th December 2023 15.30hrs . Walking along Evesham road on the left pavement heading away form Cheltenham, stepped over two large branches fallen onto the pavement from the tree canopy above. Situated just along from Wellington road off Evesham road. Please arrange inspection of all trees for loose branches. Kind regards,
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to Birdlip Farm requires h markings on the road to stop vehicles right up to single vehicle road., 21st December
item.description:
We had a fire related incident with the fire engine taking eight minutes to be able to gain access to our single vehicle entrance road. H markings are required as a matter urgency to stop vehicles parking right up to our roadway. If this had been a serious fire a life may have been lost. Can we have these markings put on the road within the next week. This report submitted on 21st December 2023.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Numerous potholes and damaged surface, 21st December
item.description:
Numerous potholes and surface dressing damage to A40 from Cheltenham to M5 junction. The "road" is more likened to a bridleway at present! Cars swerving to avoid without regard to lane discipline pose a significant safety risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 21st December
item.description:
email rcvd 20.12.23 - Hello Down Church road Longlevens opposite the Church there is a huge pot hole which is probably causing damage to a lot of cars. This is a place where there a lot of children are walking too so you can not avoid the hole. I’m just wondering when this could be fixed as it’s a deep one! Thanks
Report on FixMyStreet
